required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Mass Balance Study of AT-527 in Healthy Adult Male Subjects (R07496998)
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label, Single-Dose Study to Assess the Absorption, Metabolism, Excretion, and Mass Balance of [14C]-AT-527 in Healthy Adult Male Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: Mass balance study of AT-527 in Healthy Male Subjects.

detailed_description.textblock: This is an open-label, single-dose study assessing the absorption, metabolism, excretion, and mass balance of [14C]-AT-527 in healthy adult male subjects.

primary_outcome.description: Total radioactivity recovery in urine and feces
Percent of radioactive dose excreted in urine and feces

intervention.description: Study participants will receive a single radiolabeled dose of 550 mg AT-527.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Minimum body weight of 50 kg and body mass index (BMI) of 18-32 kg/m2
- No clinically significant diseases captured in the medical history or clinically significant findings at screening physical examination.
- A non-vasectomized, male subject must agree to use a condom with spermicide or abstain from sexual intercourse during the study until 90 days after dosing. (No restrictions are required for a vasectomized male provided his vasectomy has been performed 4 months or more prior to dosing. A male who has been vasectomized less than 4 months prior to dosing must follow the same restrictions as a non-vasectomized male).
- Willing to comply with the study requirements and to provide written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Infected with hepatitis B virus, hepatitis C virus, HIV or COVID-19
- Abuse of alcohol or drugs
- Use of other investigational drugs within 28 days of dosing
- Other clinically significant medical conditions or laboratory abnormalities

eligibility.gender_description: Healthy, adult male, 19-55 years of age, inclusive, at the screening visit.
